\_sh v3.0  400  MDF 4.0
\_DateStampHasFourDigitYear

\lx aaa
\nt --------------------

Source (as of 5 July 2007):
http://www.seasite.niu.edu/Indonesian/download_the_indonesian_dictiona.htm
which links to this downloadable file:
http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/diction2.zip

Converted to SFM (standard format markers) by Jonathan Coombs, 2005-2007

I downloaded this Indonesian --> English dictionary off the seasite website and converted it from HTML (3MB) to unformatted TXT (1.8MB), and then into SFM (1.6MB), a widely used format for dictionaries, supported by many free tools, including FLEx (part of FieldWorks, from sil.org), Lexique Pro (lexiquepro.com), and Shoebox/Toolbox (sil.org). I have not edited the data itself, just the labels.

To find a word while viewing it in any text editor, I first go to Edit, Find. E.g. to find the word 'hidup', I try to find:
  \lx hidup
If it doesn't have its own entry, I do a more general search:
  hidup
This will find every place 'hidup' is used in any definition or example sentence--a great way to do a word study! (Note: The quality of the English translations is not nearly as high as the Indonesian example sentences themselves, so this is a good resource for learning Indonesian, not English.)

To interactively browse/search/re-sort the dictionary using Lexique Pro, simply open the file in Lexique. The first time, the configuration wizard will ask a lot of questions, unless you already have a file such as "seasite_dict_ind_2 - Config.xml" in the same place as this dictionary file, "seasite_dict_ind_2.txt". You can get by with just the default settings, but if you want to see the definitions in Indonesian as well as English, make sure you check that box.

To use it in FLEx, you must first import it using the built-in MDF import wizard.

To use it from Toolbox (available for free from www.sil.org), set up your jump path so that right-clicking a word will instantly cause that word's entry to appear in the lexicon window--a very nice Toolbox feature!

To do a word study from Toolbox, do a concordance search of the 
\xv field for a specific Indonesian word. This will generate a list of every place the word is used in an example sentence anywhere in the lexicon. This is nicer than using Edit, Find from NotePad, but be aware that it only searches the example sentences, so it's not quite as complete. Another option is to open it in Microsoft Word and do a Find All.

enjoy!
-Jonathan

NOTES:

"numerous sources were consulted for the compilation of this dictionary. Perhaps the most frequently used source was An Indonesian-English Dictionary by John M. Echols and Hassan Shadily, Cornell University Press 3rd Ed., 1989."

Standard Format (MDF 4.0) labels used:
 lx = lexical entry
 de = definition (English)
 ge = gloss (one-word definition, English)
 dv = definition (vernacular)
 nt = note
 xv = example sentence (vernacular)
 dt = date last edited

Manual steps for converting from HTML to SFM (MDF):
- Make a copy with a .TXT extension instead of .HTM, then open it in a text editor (e.g. Microsoft Word).
- Replace all "<P><A href= http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/"
         with "<P>Hear This Word: http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/"
- Replace all "> Hear This Word</A>"
         with ""
- Replace all "<P><A href= http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/picture/"
         with "<P>See a Picture: http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/picture/"
- Replace all "> See a Picture</A>"
         with ""
  (By the way, there were 4,067 audio clips and 207 pictures as of 5 July 2007.)
- Save and close.
- Rename from .TXT back to .HTM, open in Internet Explorer, Select All, and Copy. Wait a bit.
- In a new Word document, choose Paste Special, Unformatted Unicode Text.
- If there are any backslashes in the file, it's best to replace them with something else.
- Replace All for each label with the corresponding MDF tag. E.g. "Word: " becomes "\lx ". (By the way, there were 6,251 entries.) Replace "Short Definition: " with "\ge ", since that's the closest MDF tag.
- Optional: Replace all "--------------------------------------------------------------------------------"
              with ""
- Optional: In Word, replace all "##" with "#", repeatedly, then replace all "#^p" with "^p"; finally, replace all "# " with "^p
\xv "
- Optional: In Word, replace all "^p^p" with "^p", repeatedly.
- Save as plain text (.TXT)
- Optional: Open the file in Toolbox and for the \lx field, replace "(4)" or "4" with " \hm 4"; do the same for 3, 2, and 1 as well. Then sort by \hm and fix entries which really do include a number (e.g. \lx S-1, \lx G30S, etc.). Finally, exit Toolbox, open the file in Word, and Replace All " \hm " with "^p\hm ", and Replace All "\xe " with "^p\xe ".
- Very optional: In Toolbox, for the \xv field, replace "= " with "\xe ", repeatedly. Then manually find and adjust any remaining occurrences of "=" in the \xv or \xe fields. This is very tricky.


--------------------

INDONESIAN DICTIONARY

\lx abad
\ge century; age, era. BER-_-_: for centuries. MENG-: last for centuries.
\de ^*1 century. 2 age, era. BER-_-_: for centuries. MENG-: last for centuries.
\dv Waktu yang lamanya 100 tahun. Zaman.
\xv Bahasa Indonesia dimulai pada ABAD ke 20.
\xe The Indonesian language began in the 20th CENTURY.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000016.WAV
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx abadi
\ge eternal, lasting, enduring
\de MEMPER --: MENG-KAN 1. immortalize, record for posterity. 2. perpetuate KE--AN: 1. durability, permanence, 2. eternity, perpetuity. PENG--AN: perpetuation
\xv Tugu itu ~ jasanya
\xe The monument immortalizes his services
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx abah
\ge direction; MENG- : to head for
\de direction MENG-: to head for, go towards

\lx abah
\hm 1
\ge direction
\de MENG --: head for
\dv
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx abai
\ge neglecful
\de MENG--KAN 1. ignore, disregard 2. underestimate, minimize 3. make light of, belittle TER--(KAN) slighted, ignored. PENG--: 1. careless or neglectful person. 2 nonchalant, or indifferent person. PENG--AN 1. careless, indifference 2. neglect 3. disobedience
\xv Pegawai itu ~ perintah majikan
\xe The employee ignored his boss' order
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx abang
\ge elder brother; address for older working-class males; +
\de ^*1 elder brother. 2 form of address for older working-class males with whom one is not acquainted. 3 form of address to one's husband or boyfriend, used as "bang".
\dv Saudara tua (laki-laki). Sinonim: mas.
\xv ABANG saya bernama Budi.
\xe My ELDER BROTHER'S name is Budi.
\xv ABANG BECAK itu sedang makan.
\xe The BECAK DRIVER is eating.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000073.WAV
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx abangan
\ge one who is not a strict follower of one's declared religion.
\de *one who is not a strict follower of one's declared religion.
\dv Orang yang mempunyai agama tetapi tidak benar-benar menjalankan aturannya.
\xv Walaupun dua-duanya Muslim tetapi yang satu ABANGAN dan yang satu santri.
\xe Even though both of them are Muslims, one is NOT A STRICT FOLLOWER of the religion and the other is.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00002984.WAV
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx abar
\ge brake
\de MENG--: 1 brake. 2 impede, hinder. 3 remove. 4. lessen --AN: inhibition PENG--AN, PER--AN braking
\xv 1. ~keadaan bahaya perang
\xe Lessen the danger of war
\xv 2. Obat baru itu ~ keadaan payah pasien itu
\xe the new medicine lessened the suffering of
the patient
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx abdi
\ge servant, slave. MENG-: serve. MENG--KAN: subjugate. Also PENG-, PENG--KAN.
\de ^servant, slave. *MENG-: serve. *MENG--KAN: subjugate. PENG-: official. *PENG--AN: 1 servitude. 2 devotion. 3 dedication.
\dv pesuruh; ajudan; pembantu.
\xv Dia sudah MENGABDI sebagai pembantu selama 10 tahun di rumah ini.
\xe She/He has SERVED as a servant for ten years in this house.
\xv
\xv Saya akan MENGABDIKAN diri di bidang
ilmu.
\xe I will SUBMERGE/SUBJUGATE myself in the
study of knowledge.
\xv
\xv PENGABDIANnya selama ini sia-sia saja.
\xe His/Her DEVOTION so far has been for
nothing.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00001561.WAV
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx abis
\ge finished, used up; completed, through, concluded. Also MENG--I, MENG--KAN, +
\de see HABIS ^*1 finished, used up. 2 completed, concluded. 3 "what do you expect?" MENG--I: 1 end, finish (speech, etc.) 2 finish off, wipe out. 3 spend (time). MENG--KAN: 1 finish (o.'s story, job, etc.). 2 spend (time). 3 use up, consume. KE--AN: run out of. PENG--AN: end, conclusion (of a story).
\dv Selesai/tamat. Sudah tidak ada lagi sisanya. Sesudah/setelah. Karena.
\xv ABISLAH riwayatnya.
\xe His life is FINISHED.
\xv Buku ini sudah ABIS dibacanya.
\xe He has already FINISHED reading this book.
\xv ABIS makan, pergilah ia ke pasar.
\xe AFTER (FINISHING) eating, she went to the market.
\xv Dia menangis, ABIS selalu dimarahi.
\xe He cried because he is always scolded.
\xv WHAT DO YOU EXPECT?
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000060.WAV
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx abjad
\ge alphabet
\de MENG -- KAN: alphabetize. PENG--AN: alphabetization. -- IAH: aphabetical
\dv
\xv

\lx abon
\ge shredded meat that has been boiled and fried.
\de shredded meat that has been boiled and fried.
\dv Daging yang sudah dihaluskan dan dimasak.
\xv ABON buatan ibu tidak kalah lezatnya dengan ABON yang dijual di toko.
\xe The SHREDDED MEAT made by mother is not less delicious than the SHREDDED MEAT that is sold at the store.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00002509.WAV
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx abonemen
\ge subscription
\de ^subscription BER-: subscribe to
\xv Saya BERABONEMEN majalah Tempo
\xe I SUBSCRIBE Tempo magazine.
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx ABRI
\ge "Angkatan Bersenjata Republik Indonesia," the Indonesian armed forces.
\de *acronym for "Angkatan Bersenjata Republik Indonesia," the Indonesian armed forces.
\dv Nama badan di bidang militer di Indonesia.
\xv Anak itu gagah berani seperti bapaknya yang anggota ABRI.
\xe That dashing youngster is like his/her father who's a member of THE INDONESIAN ARMED FORCES.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00002241.WAV
\pc http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/picture/abri1.jpg
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx abruk
\ge NG-IN slam or set s.t. down with a crash
\dv
\xv Langsung saja mereka nyelonong ke bangku paling depan dan ~ pantat di sana -- They went directly to the first row and threw their behinds onto the benches there.

\lx absah
\ge valid, legal, legitimate
\de *MENG--KAN: 1. endorse, approve 2. legalize KE--AN: validity, legality PENG--AN: 1. endorsement, approval 2. legalization
\dv
\xv *Pemerintahan Habibie MENGABSAHKAN penangkapan para mahasiswa
\xe Habibie Adminstration LEGALIZES the arrest of students.
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\xe absolute power

\lx AC
\ge air conditioning.
\de *air conditioning.
\dv Alat pendingin ruangan.
\xv AC ini sudah tidak bekerja dengan baik lagi.
\xe This AIR-CONDITIONING doesn't work well anymore.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00002243.WAV
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx acak
\ge 1.disordered; 2. random
\de *SECARA- = at random *-(2)AN = in disorder, chaos *MENG- = mess up, put in disorder
\xv Dalam penelitian itu, Adi menggunakan sampel SECARA ACAK
\xe In that research, Adi used RANDOM SAMPLES.
\xv Rambutnya ACAK-ACAKAN karena tertiup angin di pantai
\xe His hair was MESSED UP because of the wind on the beach.
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx acap
\ge be stuck deep in a th., be in
\de ^be stuck deep in a th., be in *MENG-I: soak s.t.
\dv -KALI : often, repeatedly. -(2): quick, repeatedly.
\xv *Saya MENGACAPI piring-piring ke dalam air sabun
\xe I soaked all plates in soapy water.
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx acapkali
\ge repeatedly, frequently
\de repeatedly, frequently
\xv Dia ACAPKALI mengganggu saya sedang belajar
\xe He REPEATEDLY bothers me while I was studying.
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx acar
\ge pickles
\de ^pickles.
\dv
\xv ACAR Jawa sangat terkenal.
\xe Javanese PICKLES are very famous.

\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx acara
\ge agenda; program; judicial procedure. BER-: to be in session. Also MENG-,+
\de ^*1 agenda. 2 program of activity. 3. judicial procedure, jurisdiction. BER-: to be in session (of court, etc.). MENG-: hand down (a court sentence). MENG--I: begin the conversation. MENG--KAN: 1 place on the agenda. 2. bring up (with a judge, etc.). PENG-: 1 lawyer, attorney. 2 master of ceremonies.
\dv Hal yang akan dibicarakan/agenda. Segala hal yang akan dipertunjukkan/disiarkan (program). Pemeriksaan perkara (dalam pengadilan).
\xv ACARA rapat itu sudah dibuat.
\xe The AGENDA for that meeting is already made.
\xv Selalu ada ACARA yang lucu di TV.
\xe There are always funny PROGRAMS on TV.
\xv Hukum ACARA pidana masih harus
disempurnakan.
\xe The laws regarding JUDICIAL PROCEDURES on the matter of crime still has to be improved.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000019.WAV
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx Aceh
\ge Special Region of Aceh, a provice in Indonesia.
\de Special Region of Aceh, one of the 27 provinces and special regions in Indonesia, located on the western end of Sumatra. Its capital city is Banda Aceh.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00003281.WAV
\pc http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/picture/aceh1.jpg

\lx acu
\ge see ACU1 (refer. . .), ACU2 (mold, shape), ACU3 (ready . . .).
\de see ACU1 (refer . . .) ACU2 (mold, shape . . .) ACU3 (ready . . .).
\dv
\xv
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00002244.WAV

\lx acu
\hm 1
\ge BER--AN: having reference. MENG-: point (a gun), refer to. Also MENG--KAN, +
\de ^*BER--AN: having reference. *MENG-: point (a gun), refer to. *-AN: hint, reference.
\dv petunjuk; rujukan.
\xv Orang itu BERACUAN pada golongan kiri.
\xe That person IS REFERRING to leftists.
\xv Setiap penyelesaian persoalan harus
MENGACU pada peraturan.
\xe Every problem- solving must REFER to the regulations.
\xv Ini buku ACUAN bagi orang yang akan
bepergian ke Indonesia.
\xe This is a REFERENCE book for people who are going on trip to Indonesia.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00002245.WAV
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx acu
\hm 2
\ge SE-: from the same mold. MENG-: shape or mold s.t. -AN: a mold.
\de *SE-: from the same mold. MENG-: shape or mold s.t. *-AN: a mold.
\dv cetak; tuang; bentuk.
\xv Bangunan ini SEACU dengan bangunan sekolahku.
\xe This building is MADE FROM THE SAME MODEL as my school building.
\xv Kue ini dibuat dari ACUAN yang berbentuk
bunga.
\xe This cake was made from a flower-shaped MOLD.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00002246.WAV
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx acu
\hm 3
\ge ready. Also MENG-, MENG--KAN.
\de ^ready. MENG-: 1 contemplate a means for obtaining a goal. 2 take up a threatening pose. MENG-KAN: to stick something out, point.
\dv siap.
\xv Ali MENGACU senapannya untuk menembak rusa itu.
\xe Ali AIMED his rifle at the deer.
\xv Edi MENGACUKAN tinjunya kepada
musuhnya.
\xe Edi POINTS his fist to his opponent.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00002247.WAV
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx acuh
\ge care. MENG--KAN: heed, care about, be concerned with. -AN: s.t. given attention.
\de ^* care. *MENG--KAN: heed, care about, be concerned about. >-AN: Something to which attention is given.
\dv Peduli; mengindahkan; memperhatikan; menghiraukan.
\xv Dia MENGACUHKAN permintaannya.
\xe She HEEDED his/her request.
\xv Ketika melihat saya, dia tak ACUH saja.
\xe When he saw me, he just IGNORED me.
\xv Anak itu ACUH TAK ACUH saja ketika
dimarahi.
\xe That child PAID NO ATTENTION when he was scolded.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000020.wav
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\ge incite, instigate
\de ^incite, instigate *MENG-: incite, instigate
\xv *Kolonial Belanda senang MENGACUM warga Indonesia
\xe Dutch colonizers liked to INCITE Indonesians against one another.
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx acung
\ge point
\de MENG--: point upward, MENG--I: point out, draw attention to MENG--KAN: 1. hold up (the hand to greet or answer) 2. point s.t. --AN: raising upward, lifting up 2. s.t. pointed forward or outward
\xv Ia ~tangannya untuk menjawab pertanyaan itu
\xe He held up his hand to answer the question
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\ge abbreviation of "Angkatan Darat" = the Army
\de abbreviation of "Angkatan Darat" = the Army
\xv

\lx ada
\ge there is; are; be present; have, own. -LAH: am, is, are. Also -PUN,+
\de ^*1 there is, are. 2 (Coll.) be, be present. 3 have, own. -LAH: am, is, are. -PUN: now, it so happens. -NYA: 1 presence. 2 existence. 3 situation. SE-NYA: whatever there is, as one finds it. *BER--: 1. be in place; 2. well-off, well-to-do *KEBER--AN: existence. *DI--KAN: presented by s.o, provided by.
\dv Hadir; telah tersedia. Mempunyai.
\xv Bapak ADA di sini.
\xe Father IS here.
\xv Apakah dia ADA uang?
\xe Does she HAVE any money?
\xv ADAKAH saudara mendengar kabar itu?
\xe HAVE (i.e., IS IT THE CASE THAT) you heard
that news?
\xv Nina ADALAH adikku.
\xe Nina IS my little sister.
\xv SEADANYA saja, tak usah repot-repot.
\xe WHATEVER THERE IS, don't be fussy about it.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000021.wav
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx adab
\ge culture; refined, proper behavior. BER-: cultured, refined. Also PER--AN.
\de 1 culture. 2 refined, proper behavior. *BER-: cultured, refined. *PER--AN: civilization, culture.
\dv Mempunyai budaya; sopan santun; baik budi.
\xv Anak itu kurang BERADAB terhadap orang lain.
\xe That child is lacking COURTESY toward other people.
\xv Suku di pedalaman itu sudah mempunyai
PERADABAN yang tinggi.
\xe That tribe in the hinterland has already had high CULTURE.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00002248.WAV
\dt 06/Jul/2007

\xv Pohon ~ di jalan
\xe A tree is blocking the road
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx adat
\ge custom, tradition, customary manners. Also BER-.
\de custom, tradition, customary manners. BER-: to be customary or traditional, well-mannered. (The picture shows couples from various Indonesian ethnic groups wearing PAKAIAN ADAT, traditional wedding dress.)
\dv aturan; kebiasaan.
\xv Anak muda itu walaupun berambut gondrong tetapi sangat BERADAT.
\xe Even though that young man has long hair, he still has TRADITIONAL MANNERS.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00003262.WAV

\de scene (in a play).
\dv Bagian babak dalam sebuah pertunjukan/sandiwara.

\lx adem
\ge 1. cool, calm. 2. cold. 3. tasteless, flat. MENG-: cool s.o. off. Also KE--AN, +
\de 1. cool, calm. 2. cold. 3. tasteless, flat. MENG-: cool s.o. off. KE--AN: felicity, peacefulness. PENG-: apparatus for cooling.
\dv Dingin; sejuk; perasaan damai.
\xv Di Bandung udaranya ADEM.
\xe In Bandung the climate is COOL.
\xv KEADEMAN suasana kota ini sangat
menyenangkan.
\xe The PEACEFUL environment of this city is very comfortable.
\xv Kipas angin ini digunakan untuk PENGADEM
udara.
\xe This fan is used as air COOLER.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00002510.WAV
\dt 06/Jul/2007

\lx adi
\ge superior
\de 1. -- DAYA: superpower. --KAWASI: force majeure. --KODRATI: the supreme power of GOD. --KUASA: superpower. --MARGA: super or main highway. --BUSANA: haute couture. 2. splendid, highly valued.
\xv Amerika Serikat adalah negara adidaya: The United States is a superpower country

\lx adik
\ge younger brother, sister or cousin;+. BER-: have younger siblings. Also MEMPER-.
\de ^*1 younger brother or sister or younger cousin. 2 form of address to younger brother or sister and younger people in extended family (esp. first cousins). 3 form of address from husband to wife, boyfriend to girlfriend. 4 form of address for service persons of either sex (waiter, etc.) younger than the speaker. BER-: have younger siblings.
\dv 1. Saudara muda. 2. Panggilan kepada orang yang lebih muda (istri dsb.). 3. Pertalian persaudaraan dengan yang lebih muda.
\xv ADIK saya ada lima.
\xe I have five YOUNGER BROTHERS AND SISTERS.
\xv Apakah ADIK mau berbelanja?
\xe Do YOU want to go shopping?
\xv ADIK IPAR saya ada di Jakarta.
\xe My BROTHER/SISTER-IN-LAW is in Jakarta.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000074.WAV
\dt 06/Jul/2007

\lx adil
\ge just, fair, equitabl; legal. MENG--I: administer justice. Also MENG--I, KE--AN,+
\de ^*1 just, fair, equitable. 2 legal. MENG--I: 1 hear, try ( a case). 2 administer justice. KE--AN: justice, justness. PENG--AN: 1 the court. 2 trial, session. 3 courthouse. 4 jurisdiction.

\de 1. deed, work. 2. good deed, charity. MENG--BAKTIKAN: put to charitable use. BER-: 1. be charitable, generous. 2. pray silently. MENG--KAN: 1. put into practice, apply. 2. do s.t. regularly. 3. carry out with devotion. -AN: good deeds, good works, regular practice. PENG--AN: doing of good deeds, sincerity in doing s.t.
\xv Pak Saleh yang kaya itu selalu MENGAMALBAKTIKAN hartanya untuk anak-anak yatim.
\xe Mr.
\xv Saleh who is rich always DONATES his money for the orphans.
\xv Mari BERAMAL untuk membangun masjid ini.
\xe Let's BE CHARITABLE to build this mosque.
\xv MENGAMALKAN ajaran agama lebih penting daripada sekedar pandai berkhotbah.
\xe TO PUT INTO PRACTICE the religous teachings is more important than just being smart at preaching.
\xv Tindakannya merupakan AMALAN yang benar.
\xe His action is a true GOOD DEED.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00002533.WAV
\dt 06/Jul/2007

\lx aman
\ge peaceful, calm; safe, secure. Also MENG--KAN, KE--AN, PENG-,+
\de ^*1 peaceful, calm. 2 safe, secure. *MENG--KAN: 1 pacify, render safe. 2 place in protective custody, hold in custody. *KE--AN: 1 safety, security. 2 peacefulness, tranquillity. PENG-: 1 safe-guard. 2 pacifier, peacemaker, conciliator. PENG--AN: 1 (Mil.) pacification. 2 efforts to achieve security.
\dv 1. Tidak ada bahaya. 2. Tidak merasa takut; tenteram; sentosa.
\xv Bayi itu merasa AMAN di pelukan ibunya.
\xe That child feels SAFE being held by its mother.
\xv Tentara MENGAMANKAN daerah itu.
\xe Soldiers are PACIFYING that area.
\xv Untuk menjaga KEAMANAN, setiap orang harus diperiksa.
\xe To ensure THE SECURITY, each person must be checked.
\xv Apakah kamu sudah memasang sabuk PENGAMAN?
\xe Have you already fastened your SAFETY belt?

\de ^*1 member (of an organization). 2 body part, limb. 3 part, component. BER-: have as member. *BER--KAN: be composed of, have as members. *KE--AN: membership.
\dv 1. Bagian dari tubuh (biasanya tangan dan kaki). 2. Orang yang masuk dalam satu golongan/organisasi.
\xv Jangan keluarkan ANGGOTA badanmu di jendela kereta api.
\xe Don't stick any of your LIMBS out of the train window.
\xv Organisasi itu BERANGGOTAKAN para ilmuwan.
\xe That organization is COMPOSED of scientists.
\xv KEANGGOTAAN Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat sangat terbatas.
\xe The MEMBERSHIP of the Legislative Assembly is very limited.

\lx anggur
\ge be unemployed, idle; cutting from a plant; grape, wine. Also (ME)NG-, PENG-,+
\de ^ANGGUR1=to be unemployed, idle. (see also NGANGGUR) *(ME)NG-: (same as NGANGGUR). NGANGGUR: to be temporarily unoccupied. *PENG-: unemployed person. *PENG--AN: unemployment, joblessness. ^ANGGUR2=slip, cutting of plants. MENG-: 1 prepare cutting of planting. 2 transplant, plant with a slip. ^*ANGGUR3=1 grape. 2 wine.
\dv 1. Tidak melakukan ada-apa. 2a. Minuman yang dibuat dari buah anggur. b. Tumbuhan/tanaman; buah.
\xv Sekarang saya sedang MENGANGGUR, jadi saya bisa membantu anda.
\xe I'm IDLE at the moment, so I can help you.
\xv Jangan jadi PENGANGGUR saja, coba carilah kerja!
\xe Don't just be an UNEMPLOYED PERSON, try to
find some work
\xv Masalah PENGANGGURAN di Indonesia susah
dipecahkan.
\xe The problem of UNEMPLOYMENT in Indonesia is difficult to solve.
\xv Berilah saya segelas ANGGUR untuk menghangatkan badan.
\xe Please give me a glass of WINE to warm up my body.
\xv Buah ANGGUR yang dikeringkan disebut kismis.
\xe GRAPES that have been dried are called raisins.

\lx angin
\ge wind; air; rumor. BER-: windy; have wind circulating. Also BER-_-_, MENG-,+
\de ^*1 wind. 2 air. 3 rumor. *BER-: 1 windy. 2 have wind circulating. BER-_-_: get some fresh air. MENG-: 1 become wind, disappear. 2 blow (of wind). *MENG--I: to supply with air. *MENG-_-_-KAN: 1 air, aerate, expose to the air. MEMPER--KAN: air, aerate. TER-: perceptible, noticeable. TER-_-_: spread (of news, rumors, etc.). *_-_-AN: blow hot and cold, fickle, be capricious. PENG-_-_-AN: aeration, airing. PER--AN: 1 ventilation. 2 balcony.
\dv Hawa/udara yang bergerak.
\xv ANGIN topan melanda Filipina.
\xe Taifun WIND runs down the Philipine.
\xv Jangan keluar! Udara sedang BERANGIN!
\xe Don't go out! The wind is BLOWING!
\xv Supaya apinya cepat besar, coba DIANGINI.
\xe For the fire to get big fast, try BLOWING AIR ON IT.
\xv Karena udara cerah, maka dia MENGANGIN-ANGINKAN bajunya di luar.
\xe Because the air is bright and clear, he AIRED his shirt outside.
\xv Pendapatmu selalu ANGIN-ANGINAN, tidak pernah pasti.
\xe Your point-of-view is ALWAYS CHANGING, never certain.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000088.WAV

\lx angkat
\ge lift, raise; take away; begin to do s.t. BER-: depart. Also BER--NYA, +
\de ^*1 lift, raise. 2 take away, remove. 3 begin to do s.t. *BER-: leave, depart, set out. BER--NYA: departure, leaving. *MEMBER--KAN: dispatch, send. *KEBER--AN: departure. PEMBER--AN: sending off, dispatch. *MENG-: 1 lift (up), raise. 2appoint, designate. 3 promote. 4 remove, take away. 5 take up. 6 adopt (a child), adapt (written material). 7 nab, pick up. MENG-_-_: praise. MENG--I: remove (many things). MENG--KAN: 1 lift up, raise. 2 roll up (o.'s sleeves). 3 dispatched. TER-: 1 able to be picked up. 2 unintentionally lifted up. *-AN: 1 branch of armed forces. 2 generation, age group, class. PENG-: 1 support. 2 instrument for lifting. 3 lifter, o. who lifts. PENG--AN: 1 appointment. 2 adoption (of child). 3 elevation. PER-: sets of equipment. SEPER-(-AN): a set of s.t.

\lx apa
\ge what, which; a question marker; or; "eh". APA-APA: anything. Also -NYA+
\de (see also BERAPA) ^*1 what, which. 2 a question marker. 3 or. 4 eh (hesitation marker, filler word). *APA-APA: anything. *-NYA: s.t. -NYAPUN: whichever o. -PUN: 1 no matter what. 2 of any kind. BER-: 1 do what. 2 see BERAPA. *MENG-: 1 why. 2 do what. MENG--KAN: do what to. NG--IN: (Jkt.) 1 do what. 2 why. MENG-_-_-KAN: do s.t. (harmful).
\dv 1. Kata tanya. 2. Sebagai pengganti sesuatu.
\xv APA arti kata-kata ini?
\xe WHAT are the meanings of these words?
\xv
Dalam hal ini saya tidak tahu APA-APA.
\xe In this matter, I don't know ANYTHING.
\xv Saya tidak tahu MENGAPA Salam malas sekolah.
\xe I don't know WHY Salam is lazy in school.
\xv APANYA yang sakit?
\xe WHAT PART OF HIM is ill?
\xv BERAPA
banyak baju yang ada di lemari ini?
\xe HOW MANY shirts are there in this
wardrobe?
\xv APAPUN permintaanya selalu

\lx asing
\ge strange, foreign, alien; odd; remote, isolated; different. Also MENG--KAN,+
\de ^*1 strange, foreign, alien. 2 odd. 3 remote, isolated. 4 different. BER-: isolate o.s. *MENG--KAN: 1 isolate. 2 exile, banish. 3 alienate. *TER-: secluded, isolated. *PENG--AN: 1 exile, banishment. 2 alienation, estrangement.
\dv ^1. Tersendiri; terpisah; terpencil. 2. Hal yang datang dari luar. ^3. Tidak biasa; aneh.
\xv Si Karjo merasa ASING ketika datang dipesta orang kaya itu.
\xe Karjo felt ODD when he arrived at that rich person's party.
\xv Karena sombong Kardi jadi TERASING di tempat kerjanya.
\xe Because he was arrogant, Kardi became ISOLATED at his workplace.
\xv Banyak orang ASING tinggal di Jakarta.
\xe There are many FOREIGN people who live in Jakarta.
\xv Makanan ini terasa ASING bagiku.
\xe This food tastes STRANGE to me.
\xv Tuti memang gadis pemalu.
\xv Dia selalu MENGASINGKAN diri.
\xe Tuti is really a shy girl.
\xv She always ISOLATES herself.
\xv Syekh Yusuf DIASINGKAN ke Afrika Selatan karena melawan Belanda.
\xe Syech Yusuf WAS EXILED to South Africa because he rebelled to the Dutch.
\xv Bung Karno pernah dibuang di tempat PENGASINGAN di Digul.
\xe President Sukarno was once cast out to a place of EXILE at Digul.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000107.WAV

\de ^*1 passionate. 2 be infatuated. 3. busy, occupied. 4. absorbed, eager. *MENG--I: eat up, devour (movie, magazines, etc.). *MENG--KAN: 1 preoccupy, engross, absorb. 2 fascinate. 3 fascinating, attractive. 4 making someone ardent or amorous. *KE--AN: preoccupation, obsession. *_-_-NYA: totally engrossed.

\lx atas
\ge on (top of); upper; above; for, because of. MENG-: go upward. Also MENG--I, +
\de ^*1 on, upon, on top of. 2 upper. 3 above, upstairs. 4 for, because of, according to. MENG-: rise, go upward. *MENG--I: 1 surpass, exceed. 2 overcome, master, surmount. *-AN: (adj.) higher, superior.

\xe Your book is on TOP OF the table.

\xe ACCORDING TO the doctor's advice, that sick woman was taken to the hospital.
\xv Hati-hati! Jangan melihat KE ATAS.
\xe Be careful! Don't look UP.

\lx atur
\ge arrange. BER-: be arranged, be in order. Also MENG-, MENG--KAN, TER-, +
\de ^*arrange. BER-: be arranged, be in order. *MENG-: 1 put in order. 2 regulate, organize, monitor. 3 arrange, settle. *MENG--KAN: put in order for s.o. *TER-: in order, arranged. *-AN: 1 arrangement. 2 regulation, rule. 3 directions, instructions. PENG--AN: arrangement, control. *PER--AN: 1 regulation. 2 system of organization.
\dv Susun.
\xv ATUR baik-baik bajumu di dalam lemari!
\xe ARRANGE your clothes well in the
wardrobe!
\xv Bosan tinggal di sini,
semuanya serba DIATUR!
\xe It's boring staying here, everything is
completely ORDERED!
\xv Tidak mudah lho
MENGATUR murid taman kanak-kanak!
\xe It isn't easy, you know, MONITORING
kindergarten students!
\xv Setiap pagi
pembantunya yang MENGATURKAN kamar
tidurnya.
\xe Every morning, his maid STRAIGHTENS UP his bedroom.
\xv Makan yang TERATUR akan baik bagi kesehatan.
\xe REGULATED eating habits will be good for your health.
\xv Banyak undang-undang baru dalam ATURAN lalu lintas.
\xe There are many new laws in the REGULATION of traffic.
\xv PERATURAN perpajakan ini memberatkan petani.
\xe This tax SYSTEM burdens the farmers.

\lx bagi
\ge for; divide. BER-: split up, divisible, shared out. Also MEM-, MEM--KAN, +
\de *^1 for. 2 divide. *BER-: split up, divisible, shared out. *MEM-: 1 divide. 2 share, distribute. *MEM--KAN: 1 share, distribute. 2 allot, allocate. -AN: 1 part (of s.t.), share. 2 part (in s.t.), participation. 3 section, division. *SE--AN: a part, some. PEM-: divider (person or thing). *PEM--AN: 1 distribution. 2 allotment, division.
\dv 1. Untuk. 2. Dipisah.
\xv BAGI anda yang sudah siap, silakan masuk!
\xe FOR you who are ready, please come in!
\xv
Tolong BAGI dua kue itu!
\xe Please DIVIDE that cake in two!

saling BERBAGI rasa dalam penderitaan.
\xe We SHARED the suffering between us.
\xv Dalam MEMBAGI hartanya, dia sangat adil.

\lx banding
\ge equivalent, equal. SE-: comparable to, equal to. Also MEM(PER)--KAN, +
\de ^equivelant, equal. SE-: comparable to, equal to. MEM(PER)--KAN: to compare s.t. with s.t. else. -AN: comparison. PEM--AN: act of comparing. PER--AN: comparison.
\dv Sama dalam hal sesuatu; imbangan; tara.
\xv Kekuatan lawan SEBANDING dengan kekuatannya.
\xe His opponent's strength was COMPARABLE to his own.
\xv Dengan MEMBANDINGKAN ke dua hal ini kita bisa mengukur besarnya.
\xe By COMPARING these two matters we can measure their size/importance.
\xv PERBANDINGAN pendapatan penduduk desa dan kota di Indonesia adalah satu BANDING sepuluh.

\lx begini
\ge thus, like this; well, so (to start a conversation). Also SE-, MEM--KAN, +
\de ^*1 thus, like this. 2 well, so (often used to start a conversation). *SE-: as . . . as this. MEM--KAN: treat in such-and-such a way. *-AN: (Coll.) s.t. like this.
\dv seperti ini. akronim:begitu.
\xv BEGINI caranya membuat sate, bukan begitu.
\xe The way to make sate is LIKE THIS, not like that.
\xv Saya mau mainan yang BEGINIAN.
\xe I want a toy that is SOMETHING LIKE THIS.
\xv Hanya SEBEGINI banyaknya uang yang kau dapat hari ini?
\xe Is the money that you got today only AS much AS THIS?

\lx begitu
\ge like that; so, very (in superlative sense); just at the moment. Also -LAH, +
\de ^*1 like that. 2 so, very (in superlative sense). 3 just at the moment, coincident with. -LAH: such, so it is, that is the case. *-PUN: 1 likewise, and so, also. 2 in spite of. *SE-: like that. MEM--KAN: treat s.o. like that.
\dv seperti itu. sangat/berlebihan/terlalu. segera setelah. akronim:begini.
\xv Kalau BEGITU batalkan saja kepergianmu.
\xe If it is LIKE THAT, just cancel your trip.
\xv Saya ingin membeli mobil yang BEGITU.
\xe I want to buy a car LIKE THAT.
\xv BEGITU kejam perlakuan ibu tirimu.
\xe Your step mother's actions are AS cruel AS THAT.
\xv Dia langsung tidur BEGITU selesai makan.
\xe He went to sleep IMMEDIATELY AFTER finishing eating.
\xv BEGITUPUN sudah bagus jangan ditambah-tambah.
\xe It's already good JUST LIKE THAT.
\xv Don't add any more.
\xv Barang-barang BEGITUAN kurang baik untuk anak-anak.
\xe Things SUCH AS THOSE are not good for children.
\xv Mengapa SEBEGITU banyak permintaanmu?
\xe Why do you have THAT MANY requests?

\lx belit
\ge coil
\de 1. coil; 2. curve, bend BER- : wind, twist in and out complicated, intricate involved, has ramifications MEM- : intertwined, interwoven, interlaced DI- : wind around something bind, wrap together involve someone MEM- -2 move in serpentine fashion, wind MEM- -I wind, wrap around something MEM- -KAN wind something TER- involved, wound about twisted -AN kink, coil, twist twist association

\ge boycott
\de meM- = boycott peM-an = boycotting
\xv Para buruh pabrik sepakat MEMBOIKOT pemilik pabrik
\xe The factory workers agree to BOYCOTT the factory owner.
\xv PEMBOIKOTAN oleh para pegawai rumah sakit menyebabkan banyak orang sakit menjadi terlantar
\xe The BOYCOTTING by the hospital workers causes many sick people become neglected.

\ge 1. buttocks; 2. hindpart first, the wrong way around; 3. back
\de 1. buttocks 2. hindpart first, the wrong way around 3. back
\dv meM- = 1. attack from the rear; 2. secretly, on the sly meM-i = turn the buttocks to peM-an = treacherous attack
\xv Penyanyi dangdut yang bernama Inul mempunyai BOKONG yang besar
\xe Dangdut singer whose name is Inul has big BUTTOCKS.
\xv Tidak sopan MEMBOKONGI orang tua
\xe Not polite to TURN THE BUTTOCKS TO the elder.

\dv berkata besar (sombong). omong kosong.

\xe Don't listen to Badu's BOASTING.
\xv Tak ada lain kerjanya BERBUAL saja.
\xe He doesn't have any other work, just BRAGGING.
\xv Memang Sudomo sangat pandai MEMBUAL.
\xe It's true, Sudomo is very adept at BRAGGING.
\xv Dia MEMBUALKAN ceritanya kanan-kiri.
\xe She SPOUTED OFF her story right and left.

\lx buat
\ge do, make; for; in order to. BER-: do, act. Also MEM-, -AN, PEM-, PER--AN.
\de ^*1 do, make. 2 for. 3 in order to. *BER-: do, act. *MEM-: 1 make. 2 do. 3 cause. *-AN: 1 make, brand. 2 product. 3 artificial, false. *PEM-: maker, producer. *PER--AN: 1 action. 2 performance. 3 conduct.
\dv buat. menciptakan sesuatu.
\xv Hadiah ini BUAT si Tuti.
\xe This gift is for Tuti.
\xv Jangan coba-coba BERBUAT seenaknya sendiri di daerah ini.
\xe Don't try TO DO whatever you want in this area.
\xv Biasanya di hari libur saya MEMBUAT kue.
\xe Usually on vacation days I MAKE cake.
\xv Sepatu ini BUATAN luar negeri.
\xe These shoes are foreign PRODUCTS.
\xv Si Jampang dianggap sebagai PEMBUAT onar oleh Belanda.
\xe Jampang was thought of as a trouble MAKER by the Dutch.
\xv Segala PERBUATAN baik dan buruk ada akibatnya.
\xe All ACTIONS good and bad have their consequences.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000233.WAV

\lx buka
\ge open. MEM-: open; to begin or start s.t. Also MEM--KAN, TER-, KETER--AN, +
\de ^*open. *MEM-: 1 to open. 2 to begin or start something. *MEM--KAN: 1 open. 2 open for s.o. *TER-: 1 opened. 2 outgoing, extroverted. *KETER--AN: openness. PEM--AN: opening, beginning. *--PUASA: to break the fasting (usually during the month of Ramadhan).
\dv Antonim: tutup.
\xv BUKA bajumu yang kotor itu!
\xe OPEN your dirty shirt!
\xv Jam berapa toko
itu akan DIBUKA?
\xe What time will this store be OPENED?
\xv Siapa yang MEMBUKA kaleng ini?
\xe Who OPENED this can?
\xv Bibi yang MEMBUKAKAN pintu untukku.
\xe Auntie OPENED the door FOR ME.
\xv Dari kemarin jendela itu TERBUKA.
\xe That window has been OPEN since yesterday.
\xv Sifat KETERBUKAAN sangat penting dalam organisasi.
\xe An attitude of OPENNESS is very important within an organization.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000234.WAV

\xe He was sentenced to death because he KILLED many people.

\xe That war is very bitter; people are KILLING EACH OTHER.
\xv Kabarnya presiden itu DIBUNUH oleh PEMBUNUH BAYARAN.
\xe The news is that president was KILLED by an ASSASIN.

\lx cakap
\hm 1
\ge words, statement. BER-: to speak or talk. Also BER-_-_, MEN--KAN, PER--AN.
\de ^*words, statement. *BER-: to speak or talk. *BER-_-_: to be engaged in a conversation, to chat. *MEN--KAN: to discuss s.t. *PER--AN: conversation, discussion.
\dv Mengeluarkan maksud dengan kata-kata. Sinonim: kata/bicara.
\xv Dilarang BERCAKAP keras-keras di tempat ini.
\xe It is prohibited to TALK loudly here.
\xv Temani dia BERCAKAP-CAKAP sebentar!
\xe CHAT with her for a moment!

perlu kita MENCAKAPKAN hal penting ini.

\de say s.t. by way of prohibition * MEN~ = 1. restrain, prevent, prohibit 2. combat, guard, against ~AN = prohibition, prevention ** PEN~ = preventative, s.t. or s.o that/who prevents s.t. or s.o PEN~AN = 1. prevention 2. combating, the fight (against)

\xe Mr.
\xv Ahmad PREVENTED Amir when he wanted to touch a barb wire.
\xv ** Orang-orang pedalaman di Indonesia memimum jamu-jamuan sebagai obat PENCEGAH penyakit kulit
\xe Villagers in Indonesia drink a lot of kinds of herbs as PREVENTIVE medicine for skin irritations.

\hm 2
\ge cowrie shell
\de cowrie shell kind of board game with receptacles often played with shells as markers
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx conteng
\ge smear, stain, blemish. BER-_-_: be smeared. Also MEN-_-_, MEN--KAN.
\de ^smear, stain, blemish. BER-_-_: be smeared. *MEN-_-_: smear, stain (with paint, charcoal, etc.). MEN--KAN: smear, stain.
\dv sinonim: coreng.
\xv Siapa yang MENCONTENG-CONTENG meja ini?
\xe Who SMEARED this table?
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000273.WAV
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx contoh
\ge specimen, sample; model, example; pattern. Also MEN-, MEN--I, MEN--KAN.
\de ^1 specimen, sample. 2 model, example. 3 pattern. *MEN-: copy, imitate. MEN--I: give s.t. as an example. MEN--KAN: show by example. PER--AN: sample, model.
\dv hal yang digunakan untuk pedoman.
\xv CONTOHlah perbuatan ayahmu.
\xe IMITATE the behavior of your father.
\xv Dalam ujian ini tidak dibenarkan MENCONTOH pekerjaan orang lain.
\xe In this exam, COPYING other people's work is not approved of.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000274.WAV
\dt 06/Jul/2007

\lx copet
\ge pickpocket. MEN-(-I): to pick s.o.'s pocket. Also KE--AN, PEN-.
\de pickpocket. *MEN-(-I): to pick s.o.'s pocket. *KE--AN: to be the victim of pickpocketing. *PEN-: a pickpocket.
\dv Orang yang pekerjaannya mencuri uang orang lain.
\xv Hati-hati di pasar. Banyak sekali PENCOPET berkeliaran.
\xe Be careful in the market.
\xv There are many PICKPOCKETS wandering around.
\xv Dia ditangkap karena ketahuan MENCOPET.
\xe He was apprehended because he was caught PICKPOCKETING.
\xv Kemarin saya KECOPETAN di toko sepatu.
\xe Yesterday, I was PICKPOCKETED in a shoe store.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000275.WAV
\dt 06/Jul/2007

\lx copot
\ge 1. dislodged; 2. broken off, detached, loosened
\de *MEN-- : take off, remove, pull out, take away *MEN--I : take off something repeatedly
\dv lepas, terlepas, longgar , cabut
\xv Dengan kasar dia MENCOPOT gambar itu dari dinding
\xe He harshly PULL OUT the picture from the wall.
\xv Kami harus MENCOPOTI tulang dari ikan itu satu persatu
\xe We have to TAKE OFF (repeatedly) the bones from the fish.

\ge design, motif, pattern. BER-: to have a design, motif or pattern.
\de *design, motif, pattern. *BER-: to have a design, motif, or pattern.
\dv Motif dasar yang dipakai untuk menghias barang (biasanya kain).
\xv CORAK yang dipakai menghias tembok itu berwarna-warni.
\xe The PATTERN that was used to decorate that wall is colorful.
\xv Kain batik ini BERCORAK burung merak.

\dt 06/Jul/2007

\lx coreng
\ge 1.scratch, streak. 2. smear
\de 1.scratch, streak. 2. smear *BER--MORENG: be filled with many dirty marks and streaks. *BER--: streaked, stripped. *MEN--: 1. cross out. 2. draw lines over, streak s.t. *MEN--I: scratch repeatedly. *MEN--KAN: streak or scrape s.t. on. *--AN: scratch, streak, smear (of lipstick).
\xv Siapa yang MENCORENG tembok putih ini?? Who DREW LINES OVER the white wall??

\lx coret
\ge scratch, streak, smear
\de *MEN-- : scratch, streak *MEN--KAN : scrape s.t. on s.t. else *--AN : scratch, line, stripe *PEN--AN : removal, eradication, scratching out
\xv Anak itu MENCORET bajunya dengan pulpen bertinta biru
\xe that child SCRATCHED her cloth with blue inked-pen.
\xv Pelukis itu MENCORETKAN kuasnya di atas kertas putih
\xe that painter SCRAPED his paint brush ON a white paper.
\xv CORETAN pelukis itu sangat tegas
\xe that painter's SCRATCHES are very strong.
\xv PENCORETAN namanya dari daftar calon gubernur membuat pendukungnya marah
\xe the REMOVAL of his name from the list of the governor candidates made his supporters angry.

\lx curah
\ge MEN-: fall (of rain). MEN--I: 1. pour on. 2. bestow upon. 3. expend. +
\de fall. MEN-: fall (of rain). MEN--I: 1. pour on. 2. betow upon. 3. expend. MEN--KAN: 1. pour s.t. on. 2. pour s.t. out, unload. 3. expend lavishly. TER-(-KAN): 1. poured on. 2. focused. -AN: precipitation, outpouring.
\xv Hari ini CURAH hujan setinggi lima centimenter.
\xe Today the rain FALL is as high as five centimeter.
\xv Ramli telah MENCURAHKAN isi hatinya padaku.
\xe Ramli has DISCLOSED his feeling to me.
\xv (lit.
\xv Ramli has UNLOADED the content of his heart to me).
\xv Perhatiannya sepenuhnya TERCURAHKAN pada ujiannya.

\lx dagang
\ge trade, commerce. BER-: trade, deal, barter. Also MEMPER--KAN, MEN--KAN, +
\de ^trade, commerce. *BER-: trade, deal, barter. *MEMPER--KAN, MEN--KAN: trade in s.t., to market something. *-AN: merchandise. PE-: trader, merchant. PER--AN: trade, commerce.

\xe Mrs.

\lx dengan

\lx dengar
\ge hear. MEN-: hear. MEN--KAN: listen to. Also MEMPER--KAN, TER-, KE--AN, +
\de ^hear. *MEN-: hear. *MEN--KAN: listen to. MEMPER--KAN: 1 let s.t. be heard or listened to. *TER-: heard, audible. *KE--AN: 1 can be heard. 2 sounds, seems, strikes o. as. *PEN-: listeners, hearers. PEN--AN: sense of hearing.
\dv Dapat menangkap suara. Mendapat kabar.
\xv Mereka sedang MENDENGARKAN radio.
\xe They are LISTENING to a radio.
\xv Saya MENDENGAR kabar itu dari keponakan saya.
\xe I HEARD that news from my niece.
\xv Saya kaget ketika TERDENGAR bunyi tembakan meriam.

\xv Aksen bicaramu KEDENGARAN aneh di telingaku.

\xe His family HUNG their fortune on his shoulders.

\xe The success of the harvest later will DEPEND on the condition of the weather.

\de 1.snarl, snapping. 2. threaten. *MENG--(I): 1. snap at. 2.threaten s.o. 3. spur (a horse). 4.gnash (teeth). *MENG--KAN: intimidate, gnash o's teeth. *--AN: snarling, snapping, threat, intimidation. *PENG--: s.o. who snarls, intimidator, threatening person. *--SAMBAL: empty bluff.
\xv Jangan percaya pada ancamannya, itu hanya GERTAK-SAMBAL saja
\xe Don't believe in his threat, that was only a BLUFF.
\xv Amir marah dan MENGGERTAK Sinta dengan kasar
\xe Amir was mad and SNAPPED at Sinta.

\lx habis
\ge finished, used up; completed, concluded; completely. Also SE-_-_-NYA, +
\de ^1 finished, used up. 2 completed, concluded. 3 completely. SE-_-_-NYA: to the utmost. *MENG--KAN: 1 finish s.t. 2 spend (time). 3 use up, consume, finish off. *KE--AN: run out of, have no more left. *PENG--AN: end, conclusion. *MENG--I: to eliminate, to finish off.
\dv Sudah tidak ada sisanya lagi.
\xv Si Gendut yang MENGHABISKAN seluruh makanan.
\xe Gendut is the one who FINISHED OFF all of the food.

\xe It's too bad that we RAN OUT OF tickets to watch movies.

\xv Prinsip saya, siapa BERHUTANG nyawa harus membayar dengan nyawa pula.
\xe In my principle, who OWES life has to pay with life too.
\xv Hari-hatilah dengan lintah darat yang suka MEMPERHUTANGKAN uangnya dengan bunga yang tinggi itu.
\xe Be careful with the money lender who likes TO LEND his money with high interest.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00002501.WAV

\dv Sesuatu yang ada di dalam suatu benda.
\xv Botol ini BERISI minyak tanah.
\xe This botol CONTAINS crude oil.
\xv Buku ini BERISIKAN cerita tentang bermacam-macam budaya.
\xe This book INCLUDES stories about different kinds of cultures.
\xv Untuk MENGISI liburan ini saya akan ke pulau Bali.
\xe I am going to the island of Bali to FILL UP this vacation.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000483.WAV

\lx jawab

\xe None of my questions WERE ANSWERED.
\xv Setiap kali ditanya dia tidak MENJAWAB; bagaimana saya tahu apa maunya?

\lx kali
\ge KALI1=river. KALI2=time, times. Also SE-, SE--AN. SEKALI=very.
\de *KALI1 = river ^*KALI2 = 1 time, times. 2 (Math.) times. *SE-: 1 once, one time. 2 at the same time. 3 when (so-and-so happens), as soon as. (also see SEKALI) SE--AN: 1 all. 2 at the same time.
\dv KALI1 = sungai.

\xe We sat on the banks of the RIVER.
\xv Berapa KALI? Tiga KALI.
\xe How many TIMES? Three TIMES.

\de [Coll.] have an urgent need to do s.t. (esp. defecate or urinate)
\xv Minta maaf saya tidak bisa terlalu lama menunggumu, maklum saya sudah KEBELET
\xe I apologize I cannot wait for you, I really NEED TO GO (to bathroom).

\lx kecap
\hm 1
\ge sound of the tongue smacking; word. Also MENG-, MENG-_-_, BER-_-_, +
\de ^1 sound of the tongue smacking. 2 word. MENG-: taste (food). *MENG-_-_, BER-_-_: to smack o.'s lips. *-AN: 1 a taste of s.t. 2 the smack of o.'s lips. PENG-: sense of taste.
\dv Bunyi yang berasal dari mulut ketika orang sedang makan.
\xv Tidak sopan dengan makan mulut BERKECAP-KECAP.
\xe It isn't polite to SMACK YOUR LIPS while you are eating.
\xv Bunyi KECAPANmu keras sekali sampai didengar meja sebelah.
\xe The sound of THE SMACKING OF YOUR LIPS is so loud that it can be heard at the other table.

\ge thick (of a liquid); strong (as of coffee); intimate. Also MENG-, KE--AN.
\de ^1 thick (of a liquid). 2 strong (as of coffee). 3 intimate (of relationships). MENG-: to thicken or coagulate. KE--AN: viscosity.
\dv pekat; tidak cair.
\xv Kalau sudah dingin sup ini akan MENGENTAL.
\xe When it is cold the soup is going to COAGULATE.
\xv Barangkali KEKENTALAN lem ini membuatnya sukar dipakai.
\xe Maybe the THICKNESS of the adhesive makes it hard to use.

\lx kerumun
\ge 1.swarm over, cluster around; 2. assemble
\de *BER--: swarm over, cluster around *MENG--I: crowd around something *--AN: crowd, throng, mob
\dv berkumpul, sekelompok, banyak orang
\xv Orang BERKERUMUN di dekat tempat kecelakaan itu
\xe The CROWD gathered around the accident site.
\xv Kami MENGEKERUMUNI paman Hadi untuk mendengarkan ceritanya
\xe We GATHERED around uncle Hadi to hear the story.
\xv KERUMUNAN penonton akhirnya bubar karena turun hujan
\xe The CROWD of audiences were finally disappeared because of the rain.

\lx kuak
\ge open, give way to make an opening
\de open, give way to make an opening *BER--: open give way to make an opening *MENG--KAN: break open a window, safe barricade, etc. ; push apart
\dv membuka, menyingkap sesuatu
\xv Angin yang sangat kencang akhirnya membuat jendela itu BERKUAK
\xe The strong wind finally forced the window to OPEN.
\xv Dengan susah payah kami berhasil MENGKUAKKAN peti besi tua itu
\xe With lots of difficulties we were able to BREAK OPEN the old chest.

\lx kuasa
\ge power, might, authority; capable, able. Also BER-, MENG--I, KE--AN, PENG- +
\de ^1 power, might, authority. 2 capable, able. *BER-: to have power or authority. *MENG--I: to dominate, take charge of, master. *KE--AN: power, authority. *PENG-: s.o. in power, one who controls. PENG--AN: authority, command.
\dv Kekuatan/kemampuan, pengaruh.
\xv Dialah yang BERKUASA di daerah sini.
\xe He is the one who HAS POWER in this area.
\xv Anak itu pandai sekali.
\xv Dia mampu MENGUASAI tiga bahasa sekaligus.
\xe That child is very bright.
\xv He can MASTER three languages at one time.
\xv Sekarang ini KEKUASAAN terbesar ada di tangan rakyat.
\xe At the present time, the greatest POWER is in the hands of the common people.
\xv Walaupun dia menjadi PENGUASA negara dia tidak sewenang-wenang pada rakyatnya.
\xe Even though he is THE ONE CONTROLLING the country, he isn't despotic toward his people.
\xv PENGUASAAN hak warisnya diberikan pada pamannya.
\xe CONTROL of his inheritance rights has been given to his uncle.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000741.WAV
\dt 06/Jul/2007

\lx kuat
\ge strong, powerful; sturdy; be abel to. Also MEMPER-, KE--AN, PENG-.
\de ^1 strong, powerful. 2 sturdy. 3 be able to. *MEMPER-: strengthen, support, confirm. *KE--AN: strength, force, intensity. *PENG-: s.t. which strengthens or supports.
\dv Tidak lemah.
\xv Siapa saja yang akan MEMPERKUAT barisan tentara?
\xe Who is going to REINFORCE the battle lines?
\xv KEKUATAN kendaraan ini bisa menyamai KEKUATAN 10 tenaga kuda.
\xe The STRENGTH of this vehicle can equal the STRENGTH OF 10 horse power.
\xv Dibutuhkan alat PENGUAT untuk menopang bangunan ini.
\xe A STRENGTHENING DEVICE is needed to support this building.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000742.WAV

\lx kukuh
\ge 1. sturdy, strong. 2. firm, tenacious. BER-: be firm in, be tenacious. +
\de 1. sturdy, strong (house, etc.). 2. firm, tenacious. BER-: be firm in, be tenacious. BERSI-: be stubborn, stick to o.'s policy. MENG--I: 1. make s.t. firm or strong. 2. hold to (a theory, policy), stand by (a decision). MENG--KAN, MEMPER--KAN: 1. strengthen, fortify s.t. 2. install, inaugurate. *PENG--AN: strengthening, affirmation, inauguration.
\dv Tidak goyah; tidak goyang; tidak bergerak.
\xv Saya tetap BERKUKUH pada pendirian saya sebelumnya.
\xe I am still FIRM IN my previous opinion.
\xv Anak itu BERSIKUKUH untuk tetap dibelikan mainan itu.
\xe The child STUBBORNLY asks to be bought the toy.
\xv Dekan yang akan MENGUKUHKAN pelantikan pejabat baru itu.
\xe The dean is the one who is going to INAUGURATE the promotion of the new officer.

\lx kurang
\ge less, decrease; minus, less; lack s.t.; lacking. Also BER-, MENG--I, +
\de ^1 less, decrease. 2 minus, less. 3 lack s.t. 4 lacking. *BER-: decrease, lessen. *MENG--I: to decrease of lessen s.t. *MENG--KAN, MEMPER--KAN: detract s.t. from s.t. else. *KE--AN: lack, shortage, deficiency.
\dv belum cukup, masih kurang.
\xv Karena sakit pendapatan tukang becak itu menjadi BERKURANG.
\xe Because he was ill, the income of that pedicab driver DECREASED.
\xv Untuk menghemat uang, kita harus MENGURANGI pengeluaran.
\xe In order to conserve money, we have to DECREASE expenditures.
\xv Dengan MENGURANGKAN beberapa bilangan hasilnya akan lebih sedikit.
\xe By SUBRACTING a few numbers, her profits will be smaller.
\xv Daerah ini sangat kering.
\xv KEKURANGAN air adalah hal yang biasa.
\xe This region is very dry.
\xv A SHORTAGE of water is a normal matter.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000755.WAV

\xe My new dress was RUMPLED because Budi was sitting on it.

\xe Do not bother him now, his mind is TANGLED (has a lot of things in his mind)

\lx laku
\ge behavior, conduct; valid, in effect; in demand, sell well. Also SE-, BER-, +
\de ^1 behavior, conduct. 2 valid, in effect. 3 in demand, sell well. *SE-: 1 as if, like. 2 as, in the capacity of. *BER-: 1 be valid, be in effect. 2 occur, happen. 3 prevail, obtain. 4 behave. 5 act as. *ME--KAN: 1 carry out, execute. 2 make, do. 3 bring about. 4 commit, perpetrate. *MEMPER--KAN: treat, handle. *KE--AN: 1 deed, act. 2 behavior. *PE-: 1 doer, agent. 2 (Thea.) performer, actor. *PER--AN: treatment.
\dv perbuatan; laris; bisa dipakai/sah.

\xe To ACT fairly toward all the employees is the key that leads to the success of a business.
\xv Hanya orang yang keji yang bisa MELAKUKAN hal ini.
\xe Only a contemptible person could DO this thing.
\xv Dia MEMPERLAKUKAN anak-anak tirinya dengan baik.
\xe He TREATS his step children well.
\xv KELAKUANmu sungguh tidak terpuji.
\xe Your ACTION really cannot be praised.
\xv PELAKU wayang itu lucu sekali.

\xv Adalah tugas kita semua untuk MELESTARIKAN lingkungan.
\xe It is the duty of all of us to PRESERVE the environment.
\xv KELESTARIAN burung Cenderawasih dari Irianjaya sedang terancam.
\xe The PRESERVATION of the Cenderawasih bird of Irian jaya is threatened.

\ge 1.soft (food, etc.). 2.easy-going, tractable in disposition. 3. benign (of tumor)
\de 1.soft (food, etc.). 2.easy-going, tractable in disposition. 3. benign (of tumor). *ME--: become soft; softening (attitude). *ME--KAN: soften s.t.; weaken s.t. *KE--AN: softness, gentleness, mildness, moderation. *PE--: softener.
\xv Daging ini terlalu LUNAK karena kamu memasaknya sangat lama
\xe The meat becomes very SOFT after you cooked it too long.
\xv Hatinya MELUNAK mendengar bujukan Siti
\xe He became SOFT after listening to Siti's persuasion.

\lx luncur
\ge slide, slip. ME-: slide. ME--KAN: 1 cause to slip. 2 launch. Also TER-, PE-.

\xv Karena kecepatannya yang tinggi, mobil ini seperti MELUNCUR di jalanan.
\xe Because of its high speed, it's like this car is SLIDING on the road.
\xv Minggu depan para ahli ruang angkasa akan MELUNCURKAN satelit baru.
\xe Next week, the astronomers are going to LAUNCH a new satelite.
\xv Supaya cepat sampai ke bawah kamu harus menggunakan alat PELUNCUR.
\xe In order to get to the bottom quickly, you must use a LAUNCHING APPARATUS.
\xv Daerah ini adalah pusat PELUNCURAN pesawat percobaan.

\de ^MAKI-MAKI: abuse with vulgar language. ME-: use abusive language towards s.o. -AN: abuse, abusive words.
\dv Kata-kata yang keji atau kotor yang diucapkan seseorang ketika dia marah, jengkel, kecewa, dll.
\xv Orang gila itu suka MEMAKI-MAKI setiap orang yang lewat di depannya.
\xe The crazy man/woman likes to SHOUT ABUSIVE WORDS to every people who pass by him/her.
\xv Dilarang mengucapkan MAKIAN di tempat yang keramat ini!
\xe It is prohibited to say ABUSIVE WORDS in this sacred place.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00001717.WAV
\dt 06/Jul/2007

\lx makin
\ge all the more, increasingly. SE-: more and more.
\de *all the more, increasingly. *SE-: more and more.

\xv Anak ini SEMAKIN besar SEMAKIN cantik.
\xe This child AS she GROW biggER she BECOMES prettiER.

\dt 05/Jul/2007

\lx maklum
\ge know, beknowledgeable; understand. Also ME--I, ME--KAN, MEMPER--KAN.
\de ^1 know, be knowledgeable. 2 understand. *ME--I: to understand s.t. *ME--KAN, MEMPER--KAN: announce, proclaim.
\dv memahami; mengerti; mengetahui.
\xv Tidak semua orang bisa MEMAKLUMI keadaannya.
\xe Not all people are able to UNDERSTAND his/her situation.
\xv Besok kami akan MEMAKLUMKAN pertunangan kami.
\xe Tomorrow we are going to ANNOUNCE our engagement.

\lx malam
\ge night. -NYA: last night. SE-: a night, one night; last night. Also BER-, +
\de malam1 = wax. malam2 = night. *-NYA: last night. *SE-: 1 a night, one night. 2 last night. *BER-: to spend the night. *KE--AN: to be overtaken by night. *SE-_-_-AN: the whole evening or night.
\dv Waktu dimana matahari sudah terbenam.
\xv Siang itu kami beristirahat saja, MALAMNYA baru meneruskan perjalanan.
\xe That afternoon we just rested, the NIGHT AFTER we continued our journey.
\xv SEMALAM kami tidak bisa tidur karena suara petir yang menyambar-nyambar.
\xe LAST NIGHT we couldn't sleep because of the sound of thunder that struck continually.
\xv Minggu ini kami akan BERMALAM di rumah saudara.
\xe This week we are going to STAY THE NIGHT in your house.
\xv Karena sudah KEMALAMAN kami tidak jadi berangkat.
\xe Because we were CAUGHT BY NIGHTFALL we weren't able to leave.
\xv Kami gelisah menunggu kedatangan ayah SEMALAM-MALAMAN.
\xe We were nervous waiting for father's arrival ALL NIGHT LONG.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000866.WAV

\xv Jangan kamu MUNGKAR dari janjimu
\xe Do not DENY the promises you made.

\de possible. *ME--KAN: make s.t. possible. *KE--AN: possibility.
\dv Tidak pasti; bisa iya bisa tidak.
\xv Baju ruang angkasa ini MEMUNGKINKAN kita berjalan-jalan di ruang angkasa.
\xe This space suit MAKES IT POSSIBLE for us to walk around in space.

\lx nya
\ge -NYA: his, her, its, their, your, the; him, her, it, them.
\de *-NYA: 1 his, her, its, their. 2 your. 3 the (one that we both know about/were talking about). 4 him, her, it, them (after verbs or prepositions).
\dv
\xv Di mana Ali? ADIKNYA sudah sampai.
\xe Where's Ali? HIS BROTHER has arrived.
\xv Hei, Ali, ADIKNYA sudah di sini!
\xe Hey, Ali, YOUR BROTHER is here!

\ge 1. extinguished. 2. calmed, suppressed, quenched. Also MEM-, MEM--I, MEM--KAN, +
\de 1. extinguished. 2. calmed, suppressed, quenched. MEM-: become extinguished, go out. MEM--I, MEM--KAN: 1. extinguish, put out. 2. suppress. TER--KAN: extinguishable. PEM-: s.t. that extinguishes. PEM--AN: putting out.

\lx Pancasila
\ge the five basic principles of the Republic of Indonesia. Also MEM--KAN, KE--AN.
\de ^the five basic principles of the Republic of Indonesia: 1. the belief in one God Almighty; 2.humanity that is just and civilized; 3. the unity of Indonesia; 4. democracy guided by the wisdom of representative deliberation; 5. social justice for all Indonesians. MEM--KAN: make s.t. in accordance with the five basic principles. KE--AN: having to do with the five principles.
\dv Falsafah bangsa Indonesia yang terdiri atas lima sila, yaitu: 1. Ketuhanan Yang Mahaesa, 2. Kemanusiaan yang adil dan beradab, 3. Persatuan Indonesia, 4. Kerakyatan yang dipimpin oleh hikmah kebijaksanaan dalam permusyawaratan/perwakilan, 5. Keadilan sosial bagi seluruh rakyat Indonesia.
\xv Penataran P4 adalah usaha untuk MEMPANCASILAKAN manusia Indonesia.
\xe The P4 (Pedoman Penghayatan dan
Pengalaman Pancasila "Guidlines for
carrying out the principles of Pancasila")
upgrading seminars are an effort to BRING
the Indonesian people IN LINE WITH
PANCASILA.

\de *MEM--I: catch by surprise; catch someone redhanded *TER-- : detected, caught in the act *KE-- : surprised, unexpectedly
\dv tertangkap basah
\xv Bapak MEMERGOKI Iwan sedang asyik merokok
\xe Father CAUGHT Iwan smoking BY SURPRISE.
\xv Pencuri itu akhirnya berhasil TERPERGOK oleh polisi
\xe the theft finnaly was DETECTED by the police.
\xv Saya KEPERGOK Amir di Chicago kemarin
\xe Yesterday I unexpectedly met Amir in Chicago.

\lx pisah
\ge BER-: to part, to be separated. BER--AN: to part from e.o. Also MEM-, +
\de ^*BER-: to part, to be separated. BER--AN: to part from e.o. MEM-: separate. *MEM--KAN: separate, isolate. *TER-: 1 separate (issue, thing). 2 to become accidentally separated. PEM-: s.t. that separates. *PEM--AN: separation, division. *PER--AN: 1 dischord. 2 leave-taking.
\dv Tidak berkumpul; berjauhan; bercerai.
\xv Kita akan BERPISAH di tikungan jalan itu.
\xe We will SEPARATE at that bend in the road.
\xv Kulihat dia MEMISAHKAN diri dari kelompoknya.
\xe I see that he has SEPARATED himself from his group.
\xv Kami hidup secara TERPISAH selama beberapa tahun.
\xe We have lived SEPARATE for a number of years.
\xv PEMISAHAN induk dan anaknya dilakukan ketika anak harimau itu sudah berumur satu tahun.

\xe everyday we hear mother LAMENTING over our father's death.
\xv Ani tidak MERATAPI kepergian suaminya
\xe Ani did not MOURN over her husband's death.
\xv RATAPAN anak itu sangat menyedihkan
\xe the WAILING of the boy is so heartbreaking.
\dt 06/Jul/2007

\de ^1. king. 2. queen. ME--I: be superior to other women in a group. -AN: king or queen that is not real.

\xe A child that lacks nutritions will be highly SUSCEPTIBLE to diseas.
\dt 05/Jul/2007

\ge *ME--: 1. stretch, extend; 2. build s.t. that spans or extends outward.
\de *ME--: 1. stretch, extend; 2. build s.t. that spans or extends outward. *ME--KAN: lay out, cause s.t to extend *TER--: extended, stretched out.
\xv Ali MERENTANGKAN tali itu sampai putus

\ge aware, conscious. MENY--I: be aware/conscious of. Also MEN--KAN, +
\de ^ aware, conscious. *MENY--I: be aware/conscious of. MEN--KAN: 1 to make aware/conscious of. 1 to make s.o. realize s.t. *TER-: 1 come to consciousness. 2 come to realize s.t. *KE--AN: 1 awareness, consciousness, attention. 2 realization. 3 become conscious of s.t.
\dv Siuman kembali dari pingsan; insaf; bangun dari tidur.
\xv Saudara-saudaranya telah MENYADARI kesalahan mereka.
\xe His/her siblings are already CONSCIOUS OF their faults.
\xv Saya baru TERSADAR bahwa uang saya hilang dicopet orang.
\xe I just now BECAME AWARE that my money was pickpocketed by somebody.
\xv Dalam menyelesaikan masalah ini dibutuhkan KESADARAN masing-masing pihak yang terikut.
\xe The ATTENTION of each involved party is required to finish this matter.

\lx sama
\ge SAMA1=same, equal. SAMA2=together, with. Also _-_, SE-, MENY-(-I/KAN), BER-, +
\de (also see SAMARATA, SAMARENDAH) ^*SAMA1=same, equal. *SAMA-SAMA:exactly the same; (response to "thank you"). SE-: fellow, peer. BER--AN: 1 be equal to e.o. 2 be in conformity with. 3 resembling, similar. MENY-: behave like. MENY--I: equal, match s.t. MENY--KAN,MEMPER--KAN: 1 compare s.t. (with). 2 treat the same as. 3 make the same. MENY-_-_-KAN: unjustifiably compare, consider the same, place on a par. MEMPER-_-_-KAN: mistakenly consider the same. KE--AN: sameness, similarity. -AN: (Coll.) of the same type. PER--AN: 1 similarity, agreement. 2 comparison. 3 equality. 4 equation ^*SAMA2=1(Coll.) together, with. 2 and. 3 do together, also do. 4(Coll.) regarding, [with, for, etc.]. 5 pl. marker of adjs. & vbs. BER-: 1 together with. 2 herewith. 3 joint, collective. *(BER)-_-_: do together BER--AN: do simultaneously. KEBER--AN: togetherness.
\dv 1. Tidak berbeda; tidak berlainan. 2. Berbareng; bertepatan. 3. Sepadan; sebanding; setara.
\xv Dua tambah dua SAMA dengan empat.
\xe Two plus two is EQUAL with four.
\xv Buku ini SAMA mahalnya dengan buku itu.
\xe This book is the SAME price as that one.
\xv Kita SAMA-SAMA berbahaya.
\xe We are in the SAME danger.
\xv "Terima kasih." "O, SAMA-SAMA!"
\xe "Thanks." "Oh, you're welcome!" Ia pergi SAMA saya.=He went WITH me.
\xv Dia dikasi minum SAMA makan.=He was given something to drink AND eat.
\xv Mau ikut SAMA?=Want to go along (TOGETHER)? Saya kasihan SAMA dia.
\xe I feel pity FOR him.
\xv Kasi SAMA saya.
\xe Give it TO me.
\xv Saya tidak dikasi sekolah lagi SAMA ibu.
\xe I am no longer sent to school BY mother.
\xv Dia bekerja BERSAMA-SAMA rakyat.=He worked WITH the people.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00000078.WAV
\dt 06/Jul/2007

\xe WHILE diving, he drank water.
\xv Ini hanya pekerjaan SAMBILAN saja.
\xe This is just a PART TIME OCCUPATION.

\de 1 sarong, a k.o. traditional Indonesian article of clothing. 2 sheath, container. *BER-: to wear a sarong, have a sheath.
\dv Pakaian khas Indonesia biasanya dipakai oleh laki-laki dari pinggang sampai ke batas mata kaki; pembungkus keris; dll.
\xv Mengapa semua keris ini tertinggal tidak BERSARUNG?
\xe Why are all of these daggers left WITHout SHEATHS?

\lx satu
\ge one. SATU-SATUNYA: single, one and only. Also BER-, BER--AN, MEMPER--KAN, +
\de one. *SATU-SATUNYA: single, one and only. *BER-: to become one, unite. BER--AN: to exist as a unified body, be united. *MEMPER--KAN, MENY--KAN: to unify, bring together. *KE--AN: unity. PENY--AN: unification. *PER--AN: 1 unity. 2 club, association.
\dv Nama bilangan sebelum dua; urutan sebagai tingkat pertama.
\xv Barang ini adalah SATU-SATUNYA milikku yang paling saya hargai.
\xe This thing is my SINGLE most valued possession.
\xv Kalau BERSATU, kita teguh; kalau bercerai, kita runtuh.
\xe If we UNITE, we will be steadfast; if we separate, we will collapse.
\xv Dia adalah pahlawan yang telah berhasil MENYATUKAN semua suku-suku bangsa di Indonesia.
\xe He is the hero that succeeded in UNITING all of the various ethnic groups in Indonesia.
\xv NEGARA KESATUAN Indonesia merdeka tahun 1945.
\xe The UNITARY STATE of Indonesia declare its independence in 1945.
\xv PERSATUAN ini akan menguatkan perjuangan kita.
\xe This ASSOCIATION will strengthen our struggle.

\lx selisih

\de 1. difference. 2.quarrel, dispute. *BER--: 1. be at certain interval in time or space. 2. quarrel, disagree, be at odds with. *MEMPER--KAN: disagree over s.t. *PER--AN: disagreement, quarrel, dispute.

\xe How much is the DIFFERENCE of your expenses today??

\xe Finally the DISAGREEMENT is solved through the court.

\xv Kopor yang berat ini tidak mungkin dibawa dengan dijinjing; kita hanya bisa MENYERETnya.
\xe This heavy suitcase cannot possibly be carried in one's hand; we can only DRAG it.
\xv Akhirnya TERSERET juga dia pada masalah itu.
\xe In the end he WAS DRAGGED into that problem.

\xv KESIBUKAN pekerjaan ini sungguh menyita semua waktuku.
\xe The BUSINESS of this work really takes up all of my time.

\xe Wati is WATERING the flowers.
\xv Ayah MENYIRAMKAN pupuk dengan hati-hati.
\xe Father POURS OUT the fertilizer carefully.
\xv Upacara SIRAMAN bagi mempelai wanita telah usai.
\xe The BATHING ceremony for the bride is over.
\xv Tempat PERSIRAMAN itu dianggap keramat oleh penduduk setempat.
\xe The BATHING PLACE is thought as sacred by the local people.

\ge mouthful; a bribe. BER-: eat with the hands. Also MENY-, MENY--I, MENY--KAN, +
\de ^1 a mouthful. 2 a bribe. BER-: eat with the hands. *MENY-: 1 eat with the hands. 2 bribe s.o. *MENY--I: feed s.o. *MENY--KAN: feed s.t. to s.o. *-AN: 1 act of eating with the hand. 2 bribe. *PENY--AN: eating with o.'s hands. 2 bribery.

\xe Grandmother is already no longer strong enough to EAT even porridge.

Its capital city is Ujungpandang. 5. Sulawesi Tenggara = the Province of Southeast Sulawesi in Indonesia. Its capital city is Kendari.

\lx sumbat
\ge stopper, plug
\de stopper, plug *--BOTOL: bottle stopper *MENY--: stop, close, plug up *TER--: stopped up, gagged *PENY--AN: clogging, obstruction, blockage.
\xv Dimana kamu simpan SUMBAT botol kecap ini??
\xe Where did you put the bottle STOPPER for this soy sauce??
\xv Sampah di selokan itu MENYUMBAT saluran air
\xe The trash in the sewer have CLOGGED the water stream.
\xv Sakit flu membuat hidungku TERSUMBAT
\xe This flu made my nose CONGESTED.
\xv Akhirnya dokter berhasil mengoperasi PENYUMBATAN saluran darah di jantungnya
\xe Finally the doctors were able to operate the BLOCKAGE in his artery.
\dt 06/Jul/2007

\lx sumber
\ge source, resource. BER-: have a source, be based on. Also BER--KAN.
\de source, resource. *BER-: have a source, be based on. *BER--KAN: have a certain thing as a source or basis.  -DAYA : resources
\dv Hal yang menjadi dasar.
\xv Cerita ini BERSUMBER dari kejadian yang nyata.
\xe This story IS BASED ON an actual event.
\xv Dengan BERSUMBERKAN dana yang hanya sedikit proses belajar-mengajar ini berjalan lancar juga.
\xe BY HAVING only a little capital AS A SOURCE, this process of study and teaching is going along smoothly.
\xv Daerah ini sangat kaya akan SUMBER DAYA alam
\xe This region is very rich of NATURAL RESOURCES.
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00001339.WAV

\lx sumpah
\ge oath; curse. BER-: swear, take an oath. MENY-: swear, curse. Also MENY--I, +
\de ^1 oath. 2 curse. *BER-: swear, take an oath. MENY-: swear, curse. *MENY--I: curse s.o. or s.t. PER--AN: the taking of an oath.
\dv Perkataan yang diucapkan sebagai janji untuk ditepati.
\xv Saya telah BERSUMPAH untuk membalas jasanya.
\xe I have SWORN to return his service.
\xv Sepanjang jalan ia MENYUMPAHI tukang copet yang kurang ajar itu.
\xe All along the street he CURSED that rascally pickpocket.

\lx syarat
\ge condition, requirement. BER-: conditional. Also BER--KAN, MEMPER--KAN, +
\de condition, requirement. *BER-: conditional. *BER--KAN: have s.t. as a condition. MEMPER--KAN: make s.t. a condition. *PER--AN: rules and regulations. see sarat
\dv Hal yang harus dipenuhi untuk lengkapnya suatu hal.
\xv Perjanjian ini BERSYARAT berat.
\xe This agreement HAS heavy CONDITIONS.
\xv Dengan BERSYARATKAN sebuah ijazah SMA pekerjaan ini akan dibuka untuk umum.
\xe By HAVING a middle school diploma AS A CONDITION, this work is going to be open for the general public.

\lx tapak
\ge 1. palm of hand or sole of foot. 2. linear measure. 3. tracks. 4. site. +
\de ^1. palm of hand, sole of foot. 2. a rough linear measure. 3. tracks, footprints. 4. site. BER-: 1. step or tread on. 2. have a foothold. BER-(-KAN): be based on, supported. \de determination to do. TEKAD BULAT = complete determination. BER-: be determined.
\dv Iktikad; kemauan; kehendak.
\xv TEKAD anakku untuk menjadi pilot sudah bulat.
\xe My son's DETERMINATION to be a pilot is already firm.
\xv Dia BERTEKAD untuk menjadi juara olimpiade.
\xe He is DETERMINED to be an olympic champion.

\lx tekan
\ge pressure. BER-: lean on. BER--AN: exerting pressure. Also MEN-, MEN--KAN, +
\de ^pressure. BER-: lean on. *BER--AN: exerting pressure. *MEN-: 1 press, suppress, oppress, enforce. *MEN--KAN: 1 stress, emphasize s.t. *TER-: pressed down, oppressed. *-AN: pressure, emphasis, stress. *PEN--AN: 1 pressing, pressuring. 2 emphasizing. *DI- : Press; put pressure.
\dv himpit; tindas; tindih.
\xv Air leding ini BERTEKANAN tinggi.
\xe This pipe water HAS high PRESSURE.
\xv Dengan MENEKAN anggaran belanja kita bisa menghemat.
\xe By ENFORCING a shopping budget we can economize.
\xv Pak guru MENEKANKAN hal ini untuk diselesaikan dulu.
\xe The teacher EMPHASIZED this matter for completion first.
\xv Betapa TERTEKAN perasaanku ketika di rumahmu.
\xe How OPPRESSED my feelings were at your house.
\xv TEKANAN UDARA saat ini sangat rendah.
\xe The AIR PRESSURE at this time is very low.
\xv Berbagai PENEKANAN dilakukan untuk menjepit lawan.
\xe Various PRESSURES were exerted in order to outflank the enemy.

\lx tentang
\ge place opposite of; about, concerning. Also BER--AN, MEN-, -AN, PER--AN.
\de ^1 place opposite of. 2 about, concerning. *BER--AN: to be opposing e.o., to be in conflict, be at odds. *MEN-: 1 to gaze at. 2 to oppose. 3 to face. *-AN: opposition. *PER--AN: a conflict or controversy.
\dv hal; masalah; bab.

\xe My opinion is always AT ODDS with your opinion.

\xe There isn't a single person that dares OPPOSE him.
\xv Kepemimpinannya mendapat banyak TENTANGAN.
\xe His leadership encountered much OPPOSITION.
\xv Ini adalah PERTENTANGAN pribadi jangan turut campur.
\xe This is a private CONFLICT, don't get involved.

\de ^fixed, definite, certain. *MEN-: certain, stable, unchanging. *MEN--KAN: determine, make certain of. *TER-: certain, specified, known (but not named). *KE--AN: certainty, stipulation.

\xv KETENTUAN ini sudah baku tidak bisa diubah lagi.

\xe The police STRAIGHTENED UP the traders in the Minggu market.

\xe These TRIVIAL matters are really taking up a lot of my time.

\lx tetes

\de drip. *MEN-: to drip. *MEN--I: to drip onto s.t. *MEN--KAN: to make s.t. fall by drips. *-AN: a drop.
\dv Benda cair yang jatuh setitik demi setitik.
\xv kalau keran itu, apalagi mengucur MENETES pun tidak.

\lx tidur
\ge sleep. Also MEN--I, MEN--KAN, TER-, KE--AN.
\de ^sleep. *MEN--I: 1 lie down on or sleep on s.t. 2 (of a man) to have sexual intercourse with s.o. *MEN--KAN: to lay s.t. down or put s.o. to bed. *TER-: to fall asleep. *KE--AN: 1 to be overtaken by sleep. 2 to oversleep.

\ge MEN-, MEN--KAN: entrust s.t. to s.o.'s care. Also MEN--I, KE--AN, +
\de ^*MEN-, MEN--KAN: entrust s.t. to s.o.'s care. *MEN--I: entrust to s.o.'s care. *KE--AN: 1 to have s.t. entrusted to o.'s care. 2 the act of keeping s.t. in trust, watching over. *-AN: s.t. entrusted to another's care.
\dv Memberikan sesuatu pada seseorang untuk disampaikan pada orang lain.
\xv Saya akan MENITIPKAN uangmu pada ibumu.
\xe I am going to ENTRUST your money TO THE CARE OF your mother.
\xv Jangan MENITIPI adikmu dengan barang-barang yang berat.
\xe Don't ENTRUST your little sister WITH THE CARE OF heavy objects.
\xv Wah repot juga KETITIPAN anak ini.
\xe Heavens, WATCHING OVER this child is troublesome.
\xv Apakah TITIPANku sudah sampai?
\xe Has THE THING WHICH I ENTRUSTED TO ANOTHER'S CARE already arrived?
\sf http://www.seasite.niu.edu/indodict/speech/00001478.WAV

\lx waras
\ge being fully conscious and in possession of one's senses.
\de being fully conscious and in possession of one's senses.
